case.name: Mahiru Selfie
case.description: Meia takes a selfie with Mahiru--somewhat reluctantly.

case.name: Mahiru Selfie
case.description: Meia takes a selfie with Mahiru--somewhat reluctantly.

case.name: Butt Pose
case.description: Meia turns around and shows her butt off in a nonchalant fashion.

case.name: Revy Fight
case.description: Meia gets into a nude fistfight with Revy.

case.name: Jura Dual Masturbation
case.description: Jura takes it upon herself to help Meia's masturbation.

case.name: Earth Sightseeing
case.description: Meia asks the table if Earth has any interesting sights to see while she's there. (Prompt Marker)

case.name: Men Info
case.description: Meia asks if any women on the table have experience dating men, and if they'd be willing to share information with her on the subject.

markers.marker: Meia questions who or what Aella defines as a "monster," since the latter says that killing them is fun.
Meia explains Omas to Aella.
Meia tells Aella that her conflict is with Revy and Revy alone.
Meia speculates that Aella has never masturbated because Earth's culture is less sexual than Mejare.
Meia attempts to reassure Aella about the latter's concerns over her apparent asexuality.
Meia thinks the crew of the Nirvana should raid San Miguel to claim magic for themselves.
Meia expresses disbelief that Earth women would have anal sex with men--or that men's "tubes" would even fit.
"...My armor deflects lasers. That's about the extent of it."
Meia expresses confusion when other players fail to explain birth control to her.
Meia doesn't know what birth control is.
Meia reacts to a bee bothering Florina.
Meia comments that another player has blue hair.
Meia comments that another player wears a bodysuit like hers.
Meia does not immediately turn back around upon losing her shorts/displaying her butt.
Meia does not immediately turn around upon losing her shorts, continuing to feel and display her butt.
Meia questions why Captain America, a man, is uncomfortable with nudity.
"Finish me off and I'll tell you."
Meia isn't sure what the purpose of the "Duel Academy" is.
Meia thinks Chazz is just spouting nonsense about alternate dimensions.
Meia is forced to listen to Chiaki tell her about Super Mario.
Meia continues to listen to Chiaki tell her about Super Mario.
Meia continues, irritated, to listen to Chiaki tell her about Super Mario.
Meia is forced to listen to Chiaki tell her about Pokemon.
Meia is forced to listen to Chiaki tell her about Samus.
Meia is forced to listen to Chiaki tell her about Street Fighter.
Meia continues to listen to Chiaki tell her about Street Fighter.
Meia has claustrophobia and expresses a hatred of restrained movement.
Meia wants coffee or water instead of alcohol.
Meia is surprised that Corrin, a member of royalty, would treat her comrades as friends even when she hasn't.
Meia misinterprets an Earth country as a whole planet.
Meia rather bluntly observes that another player's skin is dark, and that such is rare on Mejare.
Meia tells Mulan that she is not interested in romantic relationships because she wants to be strictly professional with her crewmates.
Meia responds to Sei's comments about her Dread.
Meia claims she dropped out of school at a young age, living on the streets.
Meia is wary of Mulan's motivations in suggesting her table-wide duel.
Meia is wary of following Dust, a man, alone to meet another man.
Meia is surprised to learn that Dust's home of Falana has been in the midst of civil war.
Meia hopes that the presence of a common enemy will help Mejare and Tarak reach peace.
Meia doesn't understand how Dust can only be "half" a virgin.
Meia assures Fidget that she and Dust have more to fear from Earth.
Meia doesn't understand how Dust can have multiple souls and somehow be his own person.
Meia tells Dust that he shouldn't expect women to all dress the same.
Meia would rather not share the details of her laser ring's technology with a man, and an alien-looking one at that.
Meia finds it unusual how Dust seems more intimidated than curious about her all-woman planet, unlike most men.
Meia wonders aloud if the Nirvana's Paksis energy core is seemingly sentient via the same methods that fused Dust's souls together.
Meia is curious about Dusts's soul fusion technology.
Meia asks more questions about Dusts's soul fusion.
Meia asks the table what sights and activities Earth has to offer. (Prompt Marker)
Meia comments that the Earth in her universe is a ravaged mechanical wasteland.
Meia responds to Elaine's late-game offer for a drink.
Meia greets the female player the first time she strips.
Meia relaxes for a moment after masturbating.
Separates lines to Misty_HGSS.
Meia tells Futaba that she likes classical music, and that it's relevant because Earthlings composed it.
"These bodysuits can get uncomfortable...although you seem quite comfortable in yours."
"Mejare doesn't have many animals...and I wish it didn't have spiders."
Good to see someone who shares my fashion sense...sort of."
Meia expresses a hatred for anyone affiliated with government or a military.
"My Dread is advanced...nothing about me needs to be."
Meia questions a character's use of honorifics.
After Moon removes her bracelet, Meia will ignore Moon entirely until the latter is about to show her chest.
Meia appreciates Ini's suggestion to visit Hakazura Temple, noting Mejare has little snow.
Meia asks Jessie, with some skepticism, more about the history of Earth.
Meia expresses disbelief that Jessie, or any woman, would let men near her anus.
Meia can't believe a man's tube would actually fit in her butt.
Meia can't believe Jessie can walk straight after having anal sex with men.
Meia tries to picture "preparing" for anal sex.
Meia presses Jessie for more information about Earth landmarks instead of bars.
Meia asks Jessie if there are stereotypes on Earth associated with women who dye their hair blue.
Meia doesn't care if Jessie thinks she's boring.
Meia would donate a million Earth dollars to her crew's resources.
Meia doesn't see how winning Jessie's favor with gifts would help her.
Meia tells Jessie she misses her family.
Meia is annoyed by Jessie thinking she's old and that her parents died of natural causes.
Meia tells Jessie that women usually think she's older than she is.
Meia responds to Jessie's greeting on the first hand.
Meia does not want to give a laser ring to Jessie, saying she could probably get one on Earth.
Meia tells Jessie that she only came to the game with Jura to keep her safe.
Meia thinks little lies pile up and are inconsiderate to others.
Meia thinks Jessie is too self-absorbed to see how white lies can still harm others.
Meia prefers sex with the lights off.
Meia thinks sex is meaningless without an emotional component.
Meia thinks it'd be a betrayal of trust to talk about her masturbation habits if she had a partner.
Meia thinks even coming here to strip without a hypothetical partner would be a betrayal of trust.
Meia thinks people deserve second chances, but not third.
Meia isn't sure what mistakes people could possibly make on a porn set.
Meia thinks any "wrong hole" insertions are coworkers playing cruel pranks on Jessie, not mistakes.
Meia doesn't understand how men could mistake one hole for another unless their vision or judgment were impaired.
Meia thinks Jessie talks about sex in too impersonal a fashion.
Meia turns down Jessie's advances.
Meia tells Jessie that her approaching younger women is embarrassing and that she should act her age.
Meia thinks an open relationship defeats the purpose of a relationship.
Meia thinks if partners are searching for other people, it's a sign the relationship is failing.
Meia thinks Jessie would be unimpressed with Mejarian (purely lesbian) pornography.
Meia rejects Jessie's offer to "experiment" with her.
Meia thinks eye contact is the most important part of any sex position.
Meia is embarrassed to hear Jessie bring up tribbing and insists she only meant kissing/caressing.
Meia wonders if having an older woman aboard the Nirvana, like Jessie, would be good for mentoring new recruits.
Meia tells Jessie about Mejare's laser rings, the woman's weapon of choice.
Meia tells Jessie that Earth is too dangerous a place to share secrets--not that she's one to do so in the first place.
Meia thinks Jessie should start sharing her own secrets if she wants to hear everyone else's so badly.
Meia sees no need to share more with Jessie than she does with her crewmates, which isn't a lot.
Meia tells Jessie that she hasn't slept around much because she avoids relationships.
Meia tells Jessie that she has no dating options, as she lives on a pirate ship where she ranks highly (making dating inappropriate).
Meia thinks smoking is disgusting and unhealthy.
Meia thinks Jessie would feel much healthier and happier if she quit smoking.
Meia tells Jessie that she's working on her tablet, not distracting herself.
Meia wants to see landmarks on Earth, not drink in a bar.
Meia suspects Jessie's account of American history isn't fully accurate and asks what part of the planet she lives in.
Meia draws parallels between Zoey, a young girl Jessie worked with, and Misty, a young girl she mentors on the Nirvana.
Meia claims that a character's breasts are probably smaller than Jura's.
Meia tells Jura that she doesn't want to seduce a man in part because their "tubes" look like a painful fit.
Meia would rather date a man than Sei.
Meia thinks it's weird how Sei keeps dragging Rin into their flirting.
Meia claims Jura and Sei would get along.
Meia tells Jura that she figured they'd both enjoy touring Earth from their Dreads since it's healthier than the one they know.
Meia sees that Jura has finished masturbating...which could lead to interesting developments.
Meia and Jura relax for a moment.
Meia asks the table how long it's been since Earth had monarchies.
Meia asks Kizuna to tell her more about Japan.
Meia asks L'Arachel for more details about her kingdom Rausten.
Meia offhandedly mentions her laser ring early on, or that she is armed with it.
Meia tells Elizabeth that she should not be confined to anyone else's restrictions over her hair.
Meia tells Elizabeth about the first man she ever saw in person.
Meia greets the male player the first time he strips.
Meia rebukes Marinette's French insult.
Meia thinks it's cute how Marinette is timid about saying "bitch."
Meia responds to Marinette's complaints about her distaste for pubic hair.
Meia doubts the existence of "cognitohazards," as Earth would've tried to use them already against the Nirvana.
Meia asks Mary, skeptically, what "sugma" means.
Meia thinks getting beaten up by monsters wouldn't really improve one's physique.
Meia is offended when Ochako suggests she was engineered.
Meia claims that very few animals exist on Mejare.
Meia questions men's ability to function in coeducational settings.
Meia asks the table if any women there have any experience dating men.
Meia questions if Miko's temple presents historically accurate accounts of Miko's reign or if it's just a shrine to her.
Meia is surprised to hear that Miko enlists a pharmacist's aid for women to have children.
Meia says that Misato's tight dress is not unlike the bodysuits common at the table.
Meia is curious to inspect NERV's technology, but doubts she'd actually be allowed near it by such a secretive organization.
Meia tells Mulan to think over her Dread pilot job offer, stating that she overvalues men's company.
Meia puts together that Mulan is from Earth, not a separate "China" planet.
Meia questions why Mulan chooses shaving pubic hair as unacceptably unnatural.
After Mulan loses her duel, Meia asks her if she'd be willing to try out as a Dread pilot.
Meia tells Mulan that men's impressive musculature is what she likes most about their bodies.
Meia tells Mulan that, as a pirate, she'll only honor her challenge if she feels like it.
Meia responds to Mulan's question about whether being shaved is rougher on her body.
After telling Mulan that she likes men's muscles, Meia is dismayed to hear that there might be a "surprise" in store for her.
Meia is confused about Mulan's planetary origins and notes she's only rarely seen snow in person.
Meia doesn't know what "phallic" means.
Meia thanks Nagisa for complimenting her breasts...or at least admits she might be insecure about them.
Meia tells Nami that her dream of mapping out the world is made trivial by satellite technology.
Meia has doubts about Natsuki's recommendation of Singapore, since she's never actually been there.
Meia notes that Navi, a fairy woman, isn't likely to understand how men's penises work anyway.
Meia tells Nayru it's better to have to let go of the past.
Meia returns Nayru's greeting and notes their similar blue hair, yet opposite personalities.
Meia claims to Nayru that she is only playing out of curiosity about men, not to relax.
Meia resents Ochako's implication that women can't fall in love.
Meia mentions her Oma and/or Fama, the women who spliced their eggs together to give birth to her, or expresses confusion with the terms "mother" and "father."
Meia acknowledges that the game has come down to her and one other player.
Meia asks what Panty means by men having "flavors."
Meia realizes another character is a pilot and perks up with interest.
Meia tells Pit that she likes fish, and that men on Tarak don't have real food at all.
Meia comments on Pit's apparent feelings towards her masturbating.
Meia questions a woman's choice to have pubic hair.
Meia says she was equally unfriendly to Raven at first.
Meia first reacts to someone masturbating after learning about the rule.
Meia tells Revy that she was surprised, and somewhat dismayed, to discover that men wrote much of Earth's classical music.
Meia tells Revy that it's easier psychologically to kill people when piloting a Dread.
Meia tells Revy that the Magno Family's headquarters are hidden away in Mejare's asteroids to evade detection.

Meia mentions that she was wealthy as a child, but lived on the streets as a teenager.
Meia asks with whom Rinkah and Corrin have been in conflict.
Meia appreciates Saki Z's recommendation of a chicken restaurant, but says she has no Earth money to pay for it.
Meia isn't sure what Sakura means by the "early '80s" and comments on Mejare's version of history.
Meia doesn't want to spend an entire week in any one Earth location.
Meia expresses disbelief that Earth women might get pregnant unintentionally.
Meia shoots down Sei's offer to jiggle her breasts.
Meia says that she'd like Sei more if she left the White Knights and joined the Nirvana's crew, since her tech experience and medical knowledge would benefit them.
Meia responds to Sei's comments about lasers.
Meia responds to Sei's greeting.
Meia tells Sei that she's a bad enough influence on Rin even without trying to seduce her.
Meia questions how Glitch City got its name.
Meia reacts to Sei telling her to relax.
Meia explains planet Mejare to Sei.
Meia is not impressed with Sei's high-tech armor.
Meia thinks she's better-suited to carrying a child than Sei is.
Meia explains Omas and Famas to Sei.
Meia comments on or questions another character's shyness.
Meia still holds a fighting stance after blocking a punch from Revy.
Meia is more interested in Starfire's recommendation of Earth's tropics than Jump City.
Meia tells Starfire that humans consider it rude to judge others on things they cannot control, like being "normal."
Meia is curious about Tamaranean breeding practices.
Meia claims that Mejarian schools are all government propaganda machines.
Meia busies herself early on with work on her electronic tablet.
Separates lines to Misty_HGSS.
Meia mentions the Mejarian anime she watched as a girl, which starred brave women pilots fighting the evil forces of men.
Meia doesn't understand why Tomoko recommends she date "boys" and not men.
Meia responds to Tomoko saying she's too casual about showing her butt.
Meia tells Tomoko to stop complaining about how introverts are victims of prejudice.
Meia tells Tomoko that she knows what embarrassment is.
Meia thinks "lesbian" sounds like an insulting term for Earth women who fall in love.
Meia tells Tomoko that she should have more self-confidence and not ask others to sandbag for her.
Meia tells Tomoko that humiliation is part of Mejarian culture, too.
Meia tells Tomoko that it's OK to be introverted, but that no one will stand up for introverts for them.
Meia asks Tomoko to describe her home country of Japan.
Meia, already confused by Tomoko's use of the word "otome," now is confused about being called "kouhai."
Meia tells Tomoko that there's no reason for her to know what a casual Earth slang term would mean.
Meia doesn't know what Tomoko means by calling Mejarians "lesbos."
Meia thinks Tomoko is just being difficult in a teenage-angst way.
Meia isn't sure what an "otome" game is.
Meia asks Tomoko about the area of Earth that her room (and home) is located.
Meia thinks Tomoko has a tendency to try to pass off her remarks as jokes when she sees that they don't go over well.
Meia asks what she's supposed to do about being "too smart," as Tomoko claims.
Meia asks if Tomoko is staring at her butt, since she previously stared at her everywhere else.
Meia tells Tomoko that strip poker could indeed be informative, but she doesn't need a recommendation for it because she's there already.
Meia explains to Twilight was she uses her tablet for.
Meia is first made aware that players have to masturbate upon losing.
Meia rebuffs Veran's requests for submission.
"No, it isn't. Technology is for using, not wearing."
Meia doubts Yuelia's/Flutter's assurances that nothing bad will happen to her if she goes unarmed.
Meia tells Yuelia/Flutter that her work always keeps her busy.
Meia tells Yuelia/Flutter that having a male parent hardly explains her having magical powers.
Meia has a hard time relaxing on the hostile planet Earth, despite Yuelia/Flutter telling her to have fun,
Meia tells Yuelia/Flutter that she is worried about her laser ring malfunctioning and being left unarmed on a foreign planet.
Meia tells Yuelia/Flutter that she doesn't appreciate being invited to ask further questions about magic when she already feels threatened.
Meia tells Yuelia/Flutter about her tablet's personal data management functionalities.
Meia tells Yuelia/Flutter that she has little personal time.
